intro: Rubus lejeunei, commonly known as the Lejeune's blackberry, is a species of brambles native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its prickly stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in woodland areas and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
